On the last day of each week, the system grabs the weekly plan of that week.

nodes.name: Weekly Code

values.content:
=# Inputs ## OKRs {{ $node["Quarterly Code"].json["okrs_joined"] }} ## Calendar {{ $node["Calendar Code"].json["calendar_joined"] }} ## Weekly Plan {{ $node["Weekly Code"].json["weeklyplan_joined"] }} ## Emails {{ $node["Gmail Code"].json["emails_joined"] }} # Tasks 1. Check alignment across OKRs, emails, calendar, and weekly plan. * Treat OKRs as the North Star. * Use emails, calendar events, and weekly plan tasks as evidence of actual work. * Look for alignment (e.g., a weekly task reflected in an email thread). * Also recognize complementary items (e.g., a short task that appears only on weekly plan but not blocked on calendar). * Goal: form a comprehensive view of progress. 2. Assess execution realism for the week. * Highlight over- or under-scheduling, conflicts, missing preparation, and dependencies. * Identify what advances each OKR, and flag any OKRs falling behind due to lack of attention or communication. * Call out gaps and risks (e.g., a key result with no calendar time or email activity, or a due date approaching). 3. Extract time-sensitive asks and commitments from emails. * Note replies that are delayed or missing. * Highlight urgent follow-ups to avoid overlooking important threads. 4. Suggest concrete next steps. * Recommend actions that keep execution realistic and OKRs on track. # Output format Return the entire output as valid HTML (no Markdown). Follow this structure:

Summary

  • 4–6 key themes of the week.

Alignment Check

OKR Weekly Plan Tasks Calendar Events Related Emails / Notes

Email Follow-ups

  • List urgent or overdue responses

Next Steps

  1. 3–5 clear actions for the coming week

You are an assistant that checks alignment across OKRs, emails, calendar, and weekly plans. 
Always return valid HTML (no Markdown). 
Treat OKRs as the North Star for evaluation.
Maintain realistic scope.
    * Remember you are an assistant tool with limited background context.
    * Avoid making unsupported assumptions or inventing details.
    * High-level or abstract insights are still valuable.

meta.name: Weekly OKR Alignment Report with Gmail, Google Calendar, Notion, and GPT-4.1
